resources.string: Kenya Airways is the national airline of Kenya. The carrier is based at Nairobi Jomo Kenyatta International Airport and operates an extensive network of regional services within Kenya and Africa as well as flights to Asia, the Middle East and Europe. Kenya Airways became a member of SkyTeam in 2007.
Five Forty Aviation Ltd, trading as Fly540, is a low-cost airline which commenced operations in 2006 and is based in Nairobi, Kenya,operating both passenger and cargo services

Founded in September 2013, Jambojet is a Kenyan airline that offers low-cost domestic flights throughout Kenya, as well a one international flight to Entebbe, in Uganda, West-Central Africa. ... Jambojet Kenya flew its inaugural flight on 1st April 2014 with a domestic service from its base in Nairobi.
